com.facebook.react.views.textinput

Class ReactEditText

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.TextView
        • android.widget.EditText
          • com.facebook.react.views.textinput.ReactEditText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener

    public class ReactEditText
extends android.widget.EditText
    A wrapper around the EditText that lets us better control what happens when an EditText gets focused or blurred, and when to display the soft keyboard and when not to. ReactEditTexts have setFocusableInTouchMode set to false automatically because touches on the EditText are managed on the JS side. This also removes the nasty side effect that EditTexts have, which is that focus is always maintained on one of the EditTexts. The wrapper stops the EditText from triggering *TextChanged events, in the case where JS has called this explicitly. This is the default behavior on other platforms as well. VisibleForTesting from TextInputEventsTestCase.
